QUESTION: I am light as a feather, but not even the strongest man can hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I? (Breath)
I am not alive, but I grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. I don't have a mouth, but I need water to live. What am I?
I am always in front of you, but can’t be seen. What am I?
I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a fortress, to be used when required. What am I?
I am tall when I am young, and short when I am old. What am I?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter, and I become even. What number am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch, will soon turn red. What am I?
Until I am measured I am not known, Yet how you miss me when I have flown. What am I?
I start at the end, and finish at the beginning, and wherever I go, I am cold. What am I?
I am not alive, but I can die. I don’t have a mouth, but I need air. What am I?
What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat and 2/4 goat
Dinner is served. It's on me. I'm more than able, I'll start off with tea. I'm in my element, periodically. With a spoon to measure and a cloth to keep clean.
If you drop me I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll always smile back. What am I?
What wears a crown but is no Prince, Is good at standing but cannot sit, Digs for years but leaves no pit, And wears its jewels inside of it?
I can be written forward, backward or upside down, and can still be read from left to right?
I am an invention that saves time and space, though I am made of paper, I can hold an unlimited amount of data. What am I?
I am so fragile that saying my name breaks me?
I can fill a room but takes up no space?
Six letters it contains, remove one letter and 12 remain, what is it?
I have many teeth, but I cannot bite. What am I?
What has 3 feet but cannot walk?
I can catch you, but can’t throw, what am I?
